page.description: Returns a number which is the Julian equivalent to a specified date.

argument.name: date
argument.description: Optional. Default = DATE(). A variable containing a date value or a character string containing a legitimate representation of a date value ( ISDATE ( Date_Value ) = .T.).

page.discussion: JDATE() returns the integer Julian date equivalent of Date_Value. The Julian date is an integer value measured in days from a special starting date. You can use the resulting value with other numeric values to do special computations on dates. For example, to compute the "day of the year", use this expression: JDATE( Date_Value ) - JDATE(CTOD("1/1/" + YEAR( Date_Value ))) + 1.
page.example: ?jdate({1/5/95}) = 2449723 ?jdate({3/10/95}) = 449787 ' computes the "day of the year" assuming today is 7/12/99 ? jdate() - jdate({1/1/99}) = 192
